sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Railroad Sanitation Act.

sections.heading: No owner or operator of a railroad shall permit any railroad car to
sections.text:
be dispatched for the transportation of or occupation by passengers unless
such cars is in a clean and sanitary condition and is free from
cockroaches, body lice, bedbugs and other vermin.

sections.heading: Owners and operators of railroads shall require railroad cars used
sections.text:
for the transportation of or occupation by passengers to be regularly
cleaned and inspected and to be fumigated or otherwise treated to free them
from cockroaches, body lice, bedbugs and other vermin.

sections.heading: Whoever violates this Act shall be guilty of a petty offense. The use of
sections.text:
any car for the transportation of or occupation by passengers when the car
is not in a clean and sanitary condition or is not free from cockroaches,
body lice, bedbugs and other vermin is a separate offense for each day such
car is so used.

sections.heading: The Illinois Commerce Commission shall enforce this Act and may
sections.text: make such inspections as it deems necessary therefor.
